name: rngonegcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))

stmt.origin: sylan(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2), wcel(c4, cgr))
stmt.pretty: sylan(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ c2, (c3 ` c1)∈ c2, c4 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3 ` c1)∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c4 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c4 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3 ` c1)∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3 ` c1)∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c4 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c4 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3 ` c1)∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(c1st, c0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c4))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cgn, c4))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c4))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cgn, c4))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3 ` c1)∈ c2)
⊣ c4 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 = ran(c4)
⊣ c3 =(inv ` c4)

comment: A ring is closed under negation. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 10-Jun-2010.)
